课程教师信息
王玉宽，男，二级研究员，博士生导师。1985年毕业于内蒙古农业大学水利系水资源专业，1990年获中科院水土保持研究所土壤侵蚀方向理学硕士；2007年获中科院成都山地灾害与环境研究所自然地理方向理学博士学位，2000年及2007年分别在拿大多伦多大学林学院、美国农业部国家土壤侵蚀实验室留学。主要从事流域管理与山区可持续发展研究。先后主持全球环境基金（GEF）项目、国家自然科学基金项目、国家973项目专题、中科院重大突破项目、先导专项课题及创新项目课题、美国大自然保护协会（TNC）项目、世界自然基金会（WWF）项目及地方项目等50余项，发表论文100余篇，出版专著3部。
徐 佩 女，博士，研究员。现就职于中科院成都山地灾害与环境研究所山区发展研究中心。2005年获中科院研究生院农学硕士学位,2009获中科院研究生院自然地理学博士学位。目前主要从事山区可持续发展和生态系统服务评价的研究工作。2010年在美国斯坦福大学作短期高访学者。与美国斯坦福大学、普渡大学等机构学者开展合作研究。先后主持和参与国家自然科学基金、中国科学院先导战略课题、中科院“一三五”重大突破项目课题以及青藏高原科考项目课题20余项，发表学术论文50余篇，专著1部。作为核心骨干参与编制了《中国山地研究与山区发展报告》和专著《青藏高原人类活动调查与评价》。
傅斌，男，中国科学院、水利部成都山地灾害与环境研究所研究员，博士生导师。研究兴趣包括生态系统服务评估、农户生计、乡村规划、生态价值转化、生态补偿以及流域综合管理。主持第二次青藏高原综合科学考察子课题“人类活动与气候变化对生态资产与生态系统服务的影响”、国家自然科学基金“基于级联过程的生态系统服务流”、“三峡库区生态服务与农户生计耦合关系与调控机制”等多项科研课题。在生态系统服务形成机理、生态资产评估模型、关键参数量化以及生态补偿与生态产品价值实现等方面产出了系列成果。出版《山区生态补偿标准》专著1部，发表学术论文50余篇，获得发明专利2项，实用新型专利专利5项，软件著作权6项。
刘勤，中国科学院成都山地灾害与环境研究所副研究员，中科院青促会会员，四川绿色低碳发展工作委员会专家，成都公园城市建设咨询委员会专家。近年来主要从事生态系统评价与管理、区域规划与可持续发展、山区减灾与绿色发展协同方面研究，发表相关科研论文30余篇，申请专利或软件著作权10余项，撰写多项研究报告及对策建议，其中2项研究成果被纳入地方专项规划。

第25节 钟点的表达；介词 nach，ab，um，bis

第29节 指示代词 der/die/das,jener/jene/jenes,dieser/diese/dieses
第30节 介词 seit，zwischen;自由说明语
第31节 句子成分的位置

第34节 序数词

第36节 介词 an，auf，über，neben，unter

孙瑾琳，德国海德堡大学日尔曼文学，中世纪学硕士；德国图宾根大学日尔曼文学，哲学专业公派博士。

法语（初级）

课程编码：180089050200MX006H-03 英文名称：French (I) 课时：60 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：王昕彦

教学目的要求
本课程是为我校各学科、各专业硕士、博士研究生(初学者)开设的公共选修课。旨在教授标准的语音语调、系统介绍基础语法知识、通俗讲解常用词汇及用法、简明解答语言表达难点，并突出法语基本技能训练及交际能力培养。通过本课程学习，要求学生掌握常用的基本语法和1000个左右的法语日常用语中的高频单词，能够借助有关工具书阅读简单的法语资料，为下一阶段学习打下良好基础。

预修课程
无

大纲内容
第一章 Phonétique 28学时
第1节 Introduction; Alphabet
第2节 les 3 voyelles [a];[e];[ε];[i];[y];[u]
第3节 conjugaison des verbes: aimer, être; articles définis
第4节 les 3 voyelles [i];[y];[u]
第5节 conjugaison des verbes: aller; avoir;articles indéfinis
第6节 interrogation simple et interrogation particulière
第7节 les 6 consonnes [p];[t];[k];[l];[m];[n]
第8节 les 4 consonnes [r];[s];[f];[∫]
第9节 les 5 voyelles [o];[œ];[ø];[ə];[ɔ]
第10节 les 7 consonnes [b];[d];[g];[z];[v];[ʒ];[ɲ]
第11节 les 4 voyelles nasales [œ̃];[ɑ̃];[ɛ̃];[ɔ̃]
第12节 les 3 demi-voyelles [j];[w];[ɥ]
第13节 prononciation de la lettre X
第14节 Révision générale phonétique
第二章 Rencontres 8学时
第1节 Bienvenue
第2节 Qui est-ce?
第3节 ça va bien?
第4节 Correspondants
第三章 Portraits 8学时
第1节 Trouvez l'objet
第2节 Portraits-robot
第3节 Shopping
第4节 Le coin des artistes
第四章 ça se trouve où? 8学时
第1节 appartement à louer
第2节 C'est par où?
第3节 Bon voyage
第4节 Marseille
第五章 Au rythme du temps 8学时
第1节 un aller simple
第2节 A londres
第3节 Le dimanche matin
第4节 Une journée avec Laure Manaudou

教材信息
1、 你好！法语 王海燕 2021年1月 外语教学与研究出版社

参考书

2、 法语（1）（修订本） 马晓宏、柳利 2021年7月 外语教学与研究出版社

课程教师信息

机器学习

课程编码：180203083900P1002H-3 英文名称：Machine Learning 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：周晓飞

教学目的要求
本课程为网络空间信息安全的专业核心课。重点讲授统计机器学习的基础理论、方法和技术,内容包括贝叶斯决策学习、分类学习、回归分析、特征表示、概率图模型、知识图谱和深度学习等。课程目的及任务是：使学生通过本课程的学习,了解机器学习的基本研究问题,掌握各种学习模型的原理、设计方法和解决途径,并具备基本的数据分析能力,为开展信息安全和人工智能相关研究方向奠定理论基础。

预修课程
概率统计、线性代数

大纲内容
第一章 绪论 3.0学时
第1节 机器学习研究背景
第2节 机器学习研究的问题
第3节 课程主要内容
第4节 课程安排
第二章 贝叶斯方法 6.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 贝叶斯决策论
第3节 贝叶斯分类器
第4节 贝叶斯学习与参数估计问题
第三章 线性分类 9.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 基础知识
第3节 感知机
第4节 Fisher鉴别
第5节 Logistic回归
第四章 非线性分类 9.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 决策树
第3节 集成学习
第4节 最近邻方法
第5节 支持向量机与核函数
第五章 回归分析 3.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 最小二乘估计
第3节 最大似然估计
第4节 扩展的非线性模型
第5节 误差分析
第六章 聚类分析 3.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 序贯方法
第3节 层次聚类
第4节 K均值聚类
第七章 特征降维 6.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 特征选择
第3节 特征降维
第八章 信息论模型 3.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 熵、最大熵
第3节 互信息
第4节 信息论优化模型
第九章 概率图模型 6.0学时
第1节 概述
第2节 有向图模型：贝叶斯网络
第3节 无向图模型：马尔可夫随机场
第4节 学习与推断
第5节 隐马尔可夫模型
第十章 神经网络与深度学习 12.0学时
第1节 前馈网络
第2节 卷积网络
第3节 Recurrent网络
第4节 神经网络与深度学习前沿概述

参考书

课程教师信息
周晓飞是中国科学院信息工程研究所研究员、博士生导师，中国科学院大学网络空间安全学院岗位教授、中国科学院大学朱李月华优秀教师。研究方向为机器学习、自然语言处理、多模态智能；在国际刊物和顶级会议TKDE、AAAI、IJCAI、CIKM、WWW、ICDM等上发表学术论文50余篇。在中国科学院大学主讲智能信息处理领域课程，包括《机器学习》、《强化学习及其应用》、《神经网络与深度学习》、《人工智能及其应用》等，深受学生欢迎，荣获2019年中国科学院大学校级优秀课程奖《机器学习》奖。

课程编码：280216040300PX008-01 英文名称：Soft Volleyball 课时：30 学分：0.50 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：陈钰娉

教学目的要求
通过课堂教学使学生初步掌握该项运动的基本技术，达到爱好气排球运动和锻炼身体的目的。

预修课程
无

大纲内容
第一章 气排球的基本常识 1.0学时
第1节 气排球的起源与发展
第2节 气排球运动的锻炼价值
第二章 气排球的发球技术 5.0学时

第2节 体侧传球技术动作讲解与练习
第3节 背向传球技术动作讲解与练习

组织与管理

课程编码：180094203700P1003H 英文名称：Organizations and Management 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：胡乃军

教学目的要求
Aim
The aim of this course is to give students an understanding of the dominant contemporary theories of organization and management and how organizations differ (or are alike) across nation states, cultures, and private and public sectors. The latter part of the course also gives an account of organizational processes and dynamics.
Learning objectives
On successful completion of this course, the student should be able to:
1) Define and explain key concepts and assumptions of different organization and management theories.
2) Understand and analyse the organizational and managerial challenges particular to organizations operating across cultures and sectors.
3) Understand organizational change and internal dynamics.

课程编码：180094203800P1002H 英文名称：Modern Food Analysis 课时：45 学分：2.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：张庆华等

教学目的要求
Knowledge
At the end of the course the students will have gained knowledge of:
? Basic principle in food analysis
? Fundamental knowledge of methods used in food analysis
? Fundamental knowledge of the instrumental analytical techniques used in food analysis
? Sampling techniques in food analysis
? Quality assessment and quality control in data analysis

Skills
The students will be able to:
? Solve problems related to food analysis;
? Recognize the limitations inherent to particular sampling or analytical procedures;
? Outline the theoretical bases underlying methods commonly used for food analysis;
? Utilize the mathematical calculations involved in food analysis; and
? Assess the importance of food composition information to the food industry.
Competencies.

Through the course the student is expected to gain the competencies to be able to:
? Apply statistically valid sampling techniques to food materials having widely diverse properties and volumes.
? Demonstrate competency in the use of standard techniques of food analysis and the treatment of experimental data.
? Apply modern instrumental methods to analyse chemical and physical properties of foods.
? Compare the purposes and methods of food analysis employed in government, research and industry.

课程编码：180094203800P1003H 英文名称：Food Fermentation and Processing 课时：60 学分：2.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：游淳等

教学目的要求
The students will become knowledgeable in food fermentation and brewing with a focus on microbiological and technological features for the manufacture of fermented food, and functionality in relation to their desired impact on food quality, nutrition, safety and shelf-life.

Knowledge
At the end of the course the students will have gained knowledge of:
? The history of food fermentation
? the microbiological and technological features used in food fermentation and their functional properties
? identity, sources and physiological characteristics of microorganisms in food fermentation
? metabolic activities of microorganisms and their influence and role on fermentation food
? basic requirements and principle of fermentation process and control
? industrial scale application of fermentation and brewing technology
? advantages of fermented food
? food grade fungi deliver/express important enzymes
? Major risk factors associated with food fermentation

Skills
The students will be able to:
? Demonstrate skills at a basic level related to the understanding the process of food fermentation
? Point to suitable methodologies for fermented parameter and process control
? How to characterize fermented foods.
? Improve the safety of fermented foods.

Competencies
Through the course the student is expected to gain the competencies to be able to:
? Apply principles of food fermentation related microorganisms
? Apply principles of industrial scale application of fermentation and brewing technology
? Understand and reflect upon the importance of food safety and quality control.

教学目的要求
This course introduces students to the key nanobiotechnological areas in which convergence of biotechnology and nanoscience contributes to biomedicine, electronics and computing with novel processes, functional nanomaterials, bioelectronic and biomedical nanodevices and biosensors. The course helps students to better understand health impacts and risk of nanoscience and technology. Another objective of this course is to provide current information on nanotoxicology for the students being aware of the health assessment demands of nanomaterials development. The basic knowledge, key concepts and real experiments will be discussed.

课程编码：180094203800P1004H 英文名称：Microbial Food Safety and Hygiene 课时：90 学分：3.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：邓智斌等

教学目的要求
Knowledge
The student should have knowledge of the basic principles of:
? Overall taxonomy, reservoirs (environment, animals and/or humans), antibiotic resistance and virulence profiles of bacterial foodborne pathogens.
? Biotic and abiotic factors determining contamination, survival and growth of microbial. pathogens in Western and Chinese traditional and modern foods.
? Methodology behind quantitative characterization of microbial compositions of such foods.
? Methodology behind molecular characterization of foodborne pathogens and elucidation of foodborne outbreaks with pathogenic bacteria and virus.
? Food control
? One Health

Skills
As a result of the course, participants will have acquired the skills:
? To possess overall knowledge of the field of microbial food safety and hygiene.
? To understand the principles, advantages and limitations for traditional and molecular methods for determining microbial contents and detecting microbial pathogens of foods
? To understand the principles, advantages and limitations of cultivation-based, DNA-based and other (e.g. Maldi-TOF) methods for identification and typing of bacterial pathogens as well as characterization of their antimicrobial resistance
? To be able to apply relevant software within predictive microbiology and bioinformatics to model growth of bacterial pathogens and spoilage organisms in foods and to use genomic data for identification and characterization of food-borne microbial pathogens.

Competences
? Competence to be able to participate in research projects on foodborne microbial pathogens.
? Competence to be able to participate in investigations of foodborne outbreaks.
? Competence to be able to participate in control measures including those covered by a food control approach.
? Competence to be able to participate in One Health interdisciplinary efforts to find efficient solutions to the multifaceted global challenges to food safety through cross-disciplinary research, education and collaboration between relevant institutions and stakeholders.

无

课程编码：180094203800P1005H 英文名称：Food Quality, Perception and Eating Behaviour 课时：90 学分：3.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：邓智斌等

教学目的要求
Knowledge
At the end of the course the students will have gained knowledge of:
? The different human senses and psychological concepts
? The basic anatomy and functioning of the human senses
? Methods for measurement of sensory properties
? Quality assessment in industrial practice
? Different theories within experimental psychology and consumer behaviour
? Cross-cultural consumer preferences and behaviour

Skills
The students will be able to:
? Demonstrate skills at a basic level related to the understanding of Food Quality Assessment methods and sensory analysis.
? Point to suitable methodologies utilized to investigate food quality and sensory properties of food products.
? Design and conduct sensory experiments for discriminative and descriptive sensory testing.
? Statistical analyse and evaluate sensory data, as well as linking sensory and consumer data.

Competencies
Through the course the student is expected to gain the competencies to be able to:
? Apply principles of sensory and consumer testing methodology.
? Apply principles of experimental design and statistical evaluation of sensory and consumer data.
? Understand and reflect upon the importance of the interaction between consumer choice behaviour and sensory properties of food products for successful new product development.

课程编码：180094203100P1013H 英文名称：Methods in Preclinical Neuroscience 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：朱岩等

教学目的要求
A multitude of methods and models are used in modern neuroscience to study molecular interactions, network, functions, behaviour etc. The aim of this course is to introduce various methods and models for preclinical neuroscience research, including methods of behavioural measurement, optical imaging and cell-type specific manipulations of brain activity that are central for these studies. The students will be introduced to various animal models currently used in neuroscience research. The techniques for generating novel transgenic models using genetic manipulation of popular model organisms, such as C. elegans, Drosophila, and mice will be described. A particular focus will be placed on the different types of genetic models used to study neurological disease. The usages of these models in modern neuroimaging, the selection of an appropriate animal model, and experimental design will be discussed. Finally, the students will be introduced to ethical considerations in animal experiments (i.e. the 3R's: Replacement, Reduction, Refinement) and legislative aspects pertaining to animal experiments.

课程编码：180094203100P1002H 英文名称：Fundamental Biomedical Signal Processing 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：孔亚卓等

教学目的要求
The aim of this course is to provide the student with a basic foundation in signal processing techniques commonly encountered in biomedical applications.
We begin the course with an introduction to computers, algorithms, and scientific computing. The goal of this part is to be able to write simple algorithms, including loops, functions, and conditional statements, which can be used for efficient analysis of data and signals. During this part the students are introduced to the MATLAB programming environment, which is used for signal processing in both this course and later ones.
The course then continues by covering relevant mathematical concepts from linear algebra and calculus, as well as their application, e.g., in the context of optimization and Fourier analysis.
The second part of the course covers topics from digital signal processing and analysis. First, the foundations of signal processing are introduced, e.g. analog to digital conversion, discrete time signals, Shannon’s sampling theorem, convolution, and filters. This will be followed by an introduction to basic tools from stochastic signal processing, including autocorrelation and power spectrum. The course is concluded with image processing methods, with special emphasis on techniques relevant for the analysis of neuroimaging data.

课程编码：180094203600P1010H 英文名称：Comparative Research Design:Globalisation, Talent Mobility, Challenges to the Welfare State and Innovative Solutions 课时：36 学分：2.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：赵红

教学目的要求
Course Objectives:
This course aims to provide PhD students with an in depth introduction to the basic elements of comparative research design at the doctoral level. The course goes beyond that of a sole methodological course by applying methods to practice through separate modules educating participants on issues of strategic societal importance for countries like Denmark and China. The modules will focus on applying comparative methods to issue like globalization, talent mobility, challenges to the welfare state and demographic trends, while keeping academic focus on available methods and elaborating on comparative research methods that will allow the PhD students to strengthen and apply comparative research methods in their thesis.

The PhD course will include exploratory, interactive workshops reflecting existing SDC funded projects, which will further build on the strengths of the SDC faculty and associates.
The course has the following objectives:
1. Provide the participants with an understanding of the importance of formulating research questions in comparative research, and how to frame and develop the literature review
2. Make the participants acquainted with how to formulate a comparative research strategy
3. Introductions to multidisciplinary theoretical and empirical approaches
4. Ensure that participants are familiar with the professional practices and role of social sciences in the Nordic Countries and China
5. Familiarize participants with the challenges and dilemmas of professional research ethics and values in social sciences in Nordic countries and China
6. For SDC PhD Students: To familiarize the participating SDC PhD students on the double degree and special requirements related to the double degree as stated by UCAS.

课程编码：180094203600P1011H 英文名称：Rethinking Classical and Modern Theory and Methodology: theorizing and method sensitivity in Social Science 课时：34 学分：2.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：赵红

教学目的要求
This PhD course aims at providing the PhD students with appropriate skills, knowledge, and capacity to choose and develop the best possible theoretical and methodological framework for their projects. Furthermore, the course will teach the students how to theorize. Very few students know tthe art of theorizing. The course will stress the importance of the classical tradition within social science theory and methods but the project is to rethink and modernize the classical legacy in order to conceptualize problems and challenges in the 21st century. We need a new mode of theorizing combined with more coherent methodologies. Finally, the course will present some fairly new middle-range theories, and some methods. Throughout the whole course the PhD-students will work on their projects in relation to the theories and methods discussed in class.

To introduce the participants to the modeling and numerical description of flow, heat and mass transport based on the fundamental equations of change.

7. Use CFD for the simulation of flow with combined heat and mass transport (COMSOL)
8. Evaluate the accuracy of approximations obtained by Computational Fluid Dynamics
9. Formulate models for transport with a small or large parameter (boundary layers)

课程编码：180094203400P1002H 英文名称：Analytical Biochemistry and Sample Preparation for Omics 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：学科核心课 主讲教师：娄晓敏等

教学目的要求
An Omics investigation is inevitably preceded by sample enrichment and purification based on the biochemical and/or physico-chemical properties of the group of molecules to be analysed. This purification is crucial, because an Omics experiment should only assay a defined group of molecules (e.g. DNA but not RNA); from a technical point it is important that samples do not contain impurities that can spoil instrumentation. Quite different purification concepts are required, because the groups of molecules subjected to an Omics study are highly diverse.This course will give theoretical and experimental insight into various enrichment and separation techniques employed in Omics studies, and outline the requirements for sample purification prior to the actual Omics analysis

教学目的要求
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:

? extract information from scientific articles of relevance to a scientific project.

? plan, carry out and finalise a project under tight time constraints.
? communicate the results of a scientific project in a report that could be shaped like a scientific article.
? constructively participate in a student-supervisor relationship.
? explore and analyse relevant technologies for solving the given problem.

教学目的要求
At the end of the course, the students should be able to:
? identify and summarise key theories and models from the curriculum.
? explain and describe business models, organisational design and management activities in a specific case.
? apply theories and models from the curriculum in a solution proposal for a specific problem and explain the relevance of the chosen theories and models.
? analyse a specific case from a strategic, tactical and operational perspective.
? formulate a synthesis including managerial, organisational and business perspectives in relation to a specific problem.
? select organisational interventions and management activities from the curriculum to support the implementation of a strategy in a company and make an argumentation for the selection.
? outline the assumptions and preconditions of a specific problem and give an account of the consequences on the possible solution if these assumptions and preconditions are changed. "
